subject: Photography
title: Abstract Photography
description: A quick, practical guide to Abstract Photography.

hook.text: Not every photograph needs to show a recognizable subject. Abstract photography turns reality into pure form.

buildup.text: Abstract photography strips subjects to color, shape, line, and texture ‚Äî removing context and narrative.

discovery.text: Reflections, close-ups, motion blur, and unusual angles can all transform familiar objects into abstractions.

twist.text: The viewer doesn't need to know what the subject is. The emotional response to form and color is the point.

climax.text: Abstract photography challenges the idea that cameras must record reality. They can also create pure visual experience.

punchline.text: When you stop showing what it is, you start showing how it feels.

quiz.question: What is the primary focus of abstract photography?
options: Form, color, shape, and texture rather than recognizable subjects
